channel.title: BBC News - Wales
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Petrol: No shortage despite queues, say retailers
item.description: Tesco and Asda say they have good availability amid queues at some filling stations.

item.title: Covid-19 in Wales: A third of positive cases are unvaccinated
item.description: A third of Covid cases are among the unvaccinated, new Public Health Wales figures show.

item.title: Cancer consultant fears for patients in Wales
item.description: Patients will come to harm as cancer services face "unprecedented times", warns Welsh cancer expert.

item.title: Insulate Britain: Climate protester, 82, prepared to go to jail
item.description: Judy Bruce from Swansea protests by sitting on motorways with members of the Insulate Britain group.

item.title: Covid: Students urged to get vaccine in freshers' week
item.description: With pop-up vaccination centres on campus, student nurses are inviting their peers to get the jab.

item.title: Seven out of 10 win benefits challenges at tribunal
item.description: More than 287,000 people in three years overturn initial government decision.

item.title: Tourette's in Wales: Teens with condition say they get no help
item.description: There is only one specialist in Wales, who does not offer support for children with the condition.

item.title: Tonypandy house fire: Man released after woman seriously hurt
item.description: A woman remains in a critical condition, but police say the fire was not caused by a criminal act.

item.title: Plaid Cymru and Greens form Cardiff council election pact
item.description: The two parties will fight as one at next year's council elections in the city.

item.title: We Fight Any Claim director who stole £800,000 to pay back only £2,000
item.description: Lauren Farr was jailed for 32 months but now only has £2,000, a court hears.

item.title: Swansea driver with Covid charged £45 to change speed course date
item.description: Norman Taylor says he was asked to pay the fee when he could not attend a class on falling ill.

item.title: Car spotted driving down Cardiff traffic-free cycleway
item.description: "Clearly this is wildly unsafe and against the law," a witness says.

item.title: Carmarthenshire teen's life 'on hold' after developing Tourette's syndrome
item.description: Megan Jones, 17, began getting head jerks in February, which have progressed to seizures.

item.title: Carmarthenshire dog rescue: Charity takes in 47 puppies
item.description: One charity has taken in almost 50 puppies who had been living in "horrendous" conditions.

item.title: Disabled boxing classes 'changes lives'
item.description: A veteran who was injured in service now teaches people with disabilities how to box.

item.title: RuPaul's Drag Race UK: Meet Cardiff's Victoria Scone
item.description: She is the first female act to appear on RuPaul's Drag Race UK.

item.title: 'I have stage four cancer but avoided chemotherapy'
item.description: Kate Molton has stage four lung cancer - but will not need chemotherapy.

item.title: Wales' ambulance crews struggle with 'worst-ever' crisis
item.description: An ambulance worker says morale is low as hospitals struggle to cope with patient numbers.

item.title: Rhys Williams: Swansea defender has found week 'tough' after alleged racial abuse
item.description: Rhys Williams has come through a "really tough" week in the wake of alleged racial abuse directed towards him, says Swansea City boss Russell Martin.

item.title: Rhys Williams: Bedfordshire Police investigate after defender is allegedly racially abused
item.description: Bedfordshire Police are investigating after Swansea's on-loan Liverpool defender Rhys Williams was allegedly racially abused by a Luton Town fan.

item.title: Alix Popham: Contact training changes must be mandatory, says ex-Wales forward
item.description: Former Wales flanker Alix Popham believes a reduction in contact training needs to be mandatory at all levels of rugby union.

item.title: United Rugby Championship: Dragons v Ospreys (Sun)
item.description: Team news and match preview for Dragons' opening URC fixture at home to Ospreys on Sunday, 26 September.

item.title: United Rugby Championship: Edinburgh v Scarlets (Saturday)
item.description: Wales centre Scott Williams will make his competitive return for Scarlets' United Rugby Championship opening match at Edinburgh.

item.title: Ysgolion yn 'fregus iawn' yn sgil achosion o Covid
item.description: Bydd rhaid ystyried cau rhai ysgolion yn Sir Ddinbych oherwydd prinder staff a chyfraddau Covid uchel.

item.title: Tourette's: 'Fi'n drist a'n grac, sa'i 'di gofyn am hwn'
item.description: Mae yna "ddiffyg dealltwriaeth a diffyg cymorth" i bobl ifanc â'r cyflwr yng Nghymru, medd Megan Jones.

item.title: Staff iechyd Cymru'n wynebu'r 'gaeaf caletaf erioed'
item.description: Rhaid i bawb ystyried sut mae helpu lleihau'r pwysau ar y GIG dros y gaeaf, meddai'r Gweinidog Iechyd.

item.title: Byw mewn fan: 'Dyma'r ffordd dw'i isio byw'
item.description: O ystyried hunanladdiad i addasu i fyw mewn fan - hanes Paul O'Neill.

item.title: Surrey yn taro 'nôl yn erbyn Morgannwg ar yr Oval
item.description: Mae hi'n edrych yn anochel bellach mai gêm gyfartal fydd hi wedi i'r tîm cartref fatio trwy'r trydydd diwrnod.
